p: During the current coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID‐19) pandemic, several questions have arisen relating to the management of pregnant women. The risk of COVID‐19 to pregnant women may be much lower than in the previous SARS epidemic. The case fatality rates (CFR) in pregnant women during the SARS and MERS epidemics were 15% and 27%, respectively 1, 2, while COVID‐19 seems to have a milder natural history 2. The available data regarding COVID‐19 are limited; therefore, maternal outcomes may be underreported at present.
